oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Camel Rock & Roll Dance Party - 1956-06-02 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: CBS Rock 'N' Roll Dance Party program sponsored by Camel cigarettes, 1956-06-02 part 1. Hosted by Alan Freed with announcer Olin Tice, starring Count Basie and his Orchestra with vocalist Joe Williams, and featuring Big Al Sears, and the Rover Boys featuring Billy Albert. Produced and directed by Lou Melamed.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Count Basie Orchestra; Rover Boys; Billy Albert; Big Al Sears
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Station announcements -- Opening statement (Alan Freed) -- Opening theme -- Opening statement (Olin Tice) -- Alan Freed introduces Count Basie and his Orchestra -- Perdido (Count Basie Orchestra) -- Camel Cigarettes commercial (Alan Freed) -- Camel Cigarettes jingle -- Alan Freed introduces Billy Albert and the Rover Boys -- Graduation Day (Rover Boys, Billy Albert) -- Alan Freed introduces Big Al Sears -- Right Now, Right Now (Big Al Sears tenor saxophone) -- Camel Cigarettes commercial (Alan Freed) -- Alan Freed introduces Count Basie and his Orchestra -- Low Life (Count Basie Orchestra)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: CBS Inc.; WCBS (Radio station : New York, N.Y.); R.J. Reynolds Tobacco Company; Camel rock 'n roll dance party (Radio program); Freed, Alan; Basie, Count, 1904-1984; Count Basie Orchestra; Williams, Joe, 1918-1999; Albert, Billy (Vocalist); Rover Boys (Musical group); Sears, Al, 1910-1990; Melamed, Louis
